alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Craig, northwestern Delaware and Ottawa Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 930 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of White Oak to 6 miles north of Seneca. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Miami... Baxter Springs... Grove... Commerce... Fairland... Afton... Quapaw... Welch... Bernice... Bluejacket... Wyandotte... Treece... Picher... Bernice State Park... Narcissa... Ottawa... Cayuga... Peoria... Cardin... Centrailia... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 287 and 324. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
